content: The Act may be cited as the "Muhammad Ali Expansion Act" and includes provisions for the inclusion of mixed martial arts fighters. The Professional Boxing Safety Act of 1996 is amended to include definitions for "fighter" and "combat sport competition," specifying that it refers to individuals participating in professional mixed martial arts or other combat sports without weapons or amateur regulation. The Muhammad Ali Expansion Act mandates the Association of Boxing Commissions to establish guidelines for rating fighters in mixed martial arts and combat sports. Amendments to the Act also include changing "boxer's purse" to "boxer or fighter's purse" in various sections. Amendments to the Muhammad Ali Expansion Act include extending the duration of rounds for fighters in mixed martial arts and combat sports competitions. The Act also expands the scope to include combat sports in addition to boxing.
